newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end higher, chip share rally continues.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end higher, chip share rally continues.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed higher on Thursday, marking the third straight day of gains on the back of rising high-tech shares. Brokers said the stock average was likely to keep its firm tone at least until the end of September, but the 22,000 level would be temporary resistance.

The key Nikkei 225 average was up 110.70 points or 0.52 percent to end at 21,461.37. Its December futures gained 180 points to 21,550. "Blue-chips, especially semiconductor shares, remained bullish, and trading volume was heavier today, indicating the market had regained its energy," said Kaoru Ichikawa, a senior trader at Kokusai Securities Co Ltd.
Fujitsu Ltd was up 30 yen to end at 1,060 yen in the third heaviest trading volume. Hitachi Ltd rose 10 yen to end at 1,070.
Shares of microchip-related equipment makers, such as Tokyo Electron Ltd and Advantest Corp, also rose.
Tokyo Electron, which produces semiconductor manufacturing equipment, was up 70 yen to close at 3,140. Advantest, a manufacturer of semiconductor testing devices, was up 70 yen to finish at 4,270.
A stronger dollar against the yen prompted buying in automobile shares, brokers also said.
